text: Has anyone else checked out commanderruminations?
I liked this article. This guy seems like a stand up Timmy.
<http://dantesdad.wixsite.com/commanderruminations/single-post/2017/05/21/Dos-and-Donts-of-EDH-Etiquette>
I think I ran across this article a few days ago. I also really like it.
Yeah, he posts his articles on reddit, so if you ever go to the sub, you probably saw it there.
Oh yea, that's where I saw it. I'm usually very active on Reddit.
We'll get that guy writing for us eventually
Have you asked?
I talked to him yesterday
Cool. What did he say?
He seems intimidated by me. I think we will get him eventually
To be fair, you can be intimidating.
That's why they call Ryan Seacrest the Jason Alt of American Idol
They get asked all the time "do you REALLY know Corbin Hosler/Randy Jackson!?"

So, even though spell mastery as a mechanic has a limited number of cards, has anyone ever read about what density of Instants/sorceries are needed to turn it on at a reasonable clip?
This could also apply to the "instant/sorcery" matters decks, for setting a minimum density of cards e.g. Metallurgic Summonings
Yea, it doesn't take much

Delerium you had to plan a little, Spell Mastery usually just happens. I don't think I've ever gone to cast Nissa's Pilgrimage in my Reki deck and not had it hit, and that's in a deck with 19 instants/sorceries.
I think it might make a difference on the card
The higher cmc ones, like dark petition is just going to get turned on so easy vs the unbound telepath one
Isn't spell mastery just 2 instants/sorceries in the gy?
Yes.
Oh you're talking about deck density.

The big problem with the mechanic is that while yes, it can turn on real easy, what are doing on the first few turns of the game? Casting mana rocks and creatures for most decks, a few will be doing spells, specifically the ramp decks that are doing kodama's reach and the like
Maybe a brainstorm gets fired off, but most instant and sorceries are going to be best mid to late game
Tutors for black, ramp for green and potentially rituals for red.
Draw for blue etc.
That being said, right Henry

<@U4V5EHQ2G> that's a bit what I was thinking about. I know some people have done stat analysis on these types of things, but wasn't sure where the numbers would fall, or if anyone had thought about it before. Like, seeing X number of I/Ss in so many cards. I would think ~20 to be an upper-moderate amount.
It depends on how much the spell mastery effect is the reason you put the card in the deck in the first place.
You really need to make them low cmc though to be cast by the time you see the mastery cards though, if that is what you are trying to maximize
The card itself probably really matters, as does the deck, too. In mono green there's no downside not having it for Nissa's Pilgrimage, but that's certainly not true in other color configurations.

I guess my thought is: 
If you're building a deck and you're considering the inclusion of a card with spell mastery, is there minimum amount of Instants/sorceries where spell mastery for most intents and purposes going to be "on" in 90+ % of games.
Honestly, I just looked at all the SM cards and there are only maybe 2-3 that look worthwhile. I don't know if the return on investment is worth the effort.

Yea I know there's not many worthwhile ones. It's more a thought experiment. This isn't limited to Spell Mastery, it just stemmed my interest. It can also apply to decks that care about casting certain card types. Like, Metallurgic summonings or Trail of Evidence.

I'm just not savvy enough with statistics to work out the answer, lol

It basically comes down to when you want the mastery to be apart of the spell, if you want it on the first turn you could cast it vs it is a finisher card or an enabler for your combo out or something, the second and third option require far fewer instants and sorceries, and they even be interactive spells like counterspells
Personally, the only one I run is petition, as the mastery is a great upside, but the worst case is a five mana tutor
Yeah. That's the best in our format.
Basically makes it a 2-mana tutor
Unless you're playing super tight cEDH Petition is a Demonic Tutor 99% of the time
Which reminds me I probably should throw a couple of foils of Petition on my deckbox want list
Could even be consider fixing in the right context
It does net you a black.
That's the worse case if whir of invention for my Breya deck, got trip blue but I need trip of something else? Whir for 0 and get suspended lotus guy
Lotus guy?
Lotus Bloom?
That's the one
has anyone seen this mentioned anywhere: <http://magiccards.info/grc/en/7.html> ?
was looking for 1 toughness zombies to clamp in my liliana deck and noticed the promo of this could very easily be argued that it's on Amonkhet
also the ability would make a lot of sense actually
with enbalm
just a thought
the follow-up thought I was wondering was has anyone played with this card at all and had any success. All I can think of that's relevant are flashback, enbalm, and unearth right?
embalm*
It stops dredge I think
ok that's kinda cool I guess
Also shuffle in effects that aren't replacement, such as the eldrazi titans.
"This removes all abilities on all cards in all graveyards — both the ones that matter in a graveyard (dredge, Chronosavant’s ability, etc.) and those that don’t."
Now it doesn't say it prevents cards from gaining these abilities. So Snapcaster could give flashback.
That would be a cool interaction to use with dralnu
Xathrid Jailer?
Xantid Jailer
When it attacks and isn't blocked, they can't use abilities on creatures in graveyards
No. Yixlid Jailer.
Palace jailer. Come on guys
Secret tech against Sedris and Varolz
That's what I was thinking of thanks, Henry
I was thinking about putting it in Hatebears
I was the selected patron for this week's Command Zone episode!
Awesome!
Vizier of Remedies is a $19 foil? You foil people are silly.
Modern is a silly format
The non-foil is $0.35.
